intro: Jacea ferdinandi, commonly known as the Ferdinand's jacea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss, while its flowers are small and clustered, often in shades of white and yellow. Jacea ferdinandi is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological resilience.
